oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-03-31 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 31, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Carl Smith (host/performer), guest performer Red Sovine (although Goldie Hill was advertised as the guest for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Louie Dunn, Lew Childre, Moon Mullican, Minnie Pearl, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Carl Smith; Rod Brasfield; Red Sovine; Louie Dunn; Lew Childre
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Carl Smith -- I've Changed (Carl Smith) Opening statement (Grant Turner, Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Carl Smith) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Carl Smith) -- Carl Smith introduces Red Sovine -- Why, Baby, Why (Red Sovine) -- Carl Smith introduces Louie Dunn and Lew Childre -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Louie Dunn fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- Carl Smith talks -- My Dream Of The Old Rugged Cross (Carl Smith) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Carl Smith) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Huskey, Junior (Roy Madison); Dunn, Louie; Smith, Carl, 1927-2010; Sovine, Red
